The world has lost 178 million hectares of forest since 1990 — however, the rate of loss has slowed globally, as more countries adapt sustainable management of forests.

More from @FAO: https://t.co/arXSN4TeZo #FRA2020 https://t.co/NHDRBgrCQg

#VaccinesWork

When people don't get vaccinated, diseases can spread, especially to those at highest risk:

⏺️ Infants too young to receive vaccines
⏺️ Older adults at risk of serious diseases
⏺️ People with low immunity

More facts from @WHO: https://t.co/skfh7BWHYP https://t.co/llkcm7Tww1

Not even the harshest conditions can stop the @WFP_SouthSudan team from delivering food assistance.

See how they're helping to avoid a humanitarian catastrophe by providing life-saving support to millions. https://t.co/hhnEWy1Kw9 #ZeroHunger 
https://t.co/PDpJCFsGZQ

Gender-based violence has intensified since the #COVID19 pandemic. 

@UN_Women is supporting vital programmes to protect women & girls from violence during the #coronavirus crisis, and at all times. https://t.co/e13cUN2gH7 https://t.co/cFrnv0ES0V

In the new episode of our podcast, Awake at Night, @MelissaFleming speaks with @UNODC's @NeilWalsh_UN.

He discusses the horrific surge of criminals exploiting & abusing children online during the #COVID19 pandemic and what he is doing to stop it. 

🔊 https://t.co/vFw01cYTi9 https://t.co/O6zhswn8gH

When food is wasted, the resources that went into producing that food are also lost. 

Here's how to help reduce food waste:
✏️ Have a weekly meal plan
👨‍🍳 Be creative with recipes
🥦 Finish leftovers 

More tips from @FAO: https://t.co/C83tWDBYQ5 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/n6wqRmKdUG

The UN in NYC has begun gradual efforts to ease workplace restrictions put in place due to #COVID19. 

Go behind-the-scenes and see what it's like for those returning to Headquarters for the first time in four months.

https://t.co/3JnItpzoDm

“As long as poverty, injustice and gross inequality persist in our world, none of us can truly rest.”

-- @antonioguterres in remembrance of @NelsonMandela at Monday's virtual #UNGA #MandelaDay commemoration. https://t.co/Ur3TEv6iBv https://t.co/fi8YIK2Fe1

“Increasingly people realize that sport can act as an enabler of sustainable development, peace & social inclusion.”

— UN global communications chief @MelissaFleming at an event commemorating Monday’s first-ever #WorldChessDay. 
https://t.co/UQPm0JoSDK

#COVID19 has exposed the lie that free markets can deliver healthcare for all, the fiction that unpaid care work isn't work, the delusion that we live in a post-racist world.

-- @antonioguterres in annual @NelsonMandela lecture. https://t.co/d7CvMcoCRM https://t.co/5dAKuTRSUI

Simple steps can help you beat the heat when temperatures are on the rise:
➡️ Stay in the shade
➡️ Remain indoors during hottest times of the day
➡️ Drink plenty of water
➡️ Avoid strenuous activities

@WHO has more tips: https://t.co/1oyLAi2MO9 https://t.co/x9sM2NoJry

Celebrate the UN’s 75th anniversary with your creativity!

Join @UNDPPA's augmented reality poster competition & show your support for peace. https://t.co/QfeHmAuC6m #UN75 https://t.co/TLXWWF8qfO

From reduced reproductive & maternal health services to a steep rise in domestic violence, the #COVID19 pandemic has rolled back decades of progress made towards gender equality. 
https://t.co/AS6MZfLVWc via @UNDP

The response to the pandemic must be based on a New Social Contract and a New Global Deal that create equal opportunities and respect the rights & freedoms of all.

-- @antonioguterres in annual @NelsonMandela Lecture on Saturday's #MandelaDay https://t.co/d7CvMcoCRM https://t.co/dToITLmoOB

"I will not give up on the pursuit of an end to the fighting, measures to alleviate the suffering of the people, and the resumption of peaceful dialogue aimed at ending the conflict".

-- @OSE_Yemen on efforts to reach a peace agreement in the country. https://t.co/wM90is9uMy

Games & sports can help get through times of crisis like #COVID19 by reducing anxieties & improving mental health. 

Monday is the first-ever #WorldChessDay. https://t.co/g8R2BnWLXU https://t.co/xdlgG5thNU

The #coronavirus crisis poses particular challenges for young people, which could persist long after the pandemic is over. 

@UNICEF is working alongside youth to help them reimagine a better world after #COVID19. via @voicesofyouth https://t.co/GI3sfZQTC8

Now is the time for global leaders to decide:
Will we succumb to chaos, division & inequality?
Or will we right the wrongs of the past & move forward together, for the good of all?

-- @antonioguterres in annual @NelsonMandela lecture on #MandelaDay https://t.co/d7CvMcoCRM https://t.co/8Hcrartavh

Lockdown measures to contain #COVID19 have resulted in migrants losing their jobs in border countries and prevented from returning home.

The UN works for gender equality, so every woman & girl can exercise her human rights & live up to her full potential.

How do we - as a world, as a human race, as a society - get better after this?

#COVID19 has exposed the lie that free markets can deliver healthcare for all, the fiction that unpaid care work isn't work, the delusion that we live in a post-racist world.

-- @Refugees Special Envoy Angelina Jolie urged UN Security Council on Friday to keep their promises to survivors of conflict-related sexual violence.

"Racism must be opposed by all means that humanity has at its disposal." -- @NelsonMandela at UNHQ in 1990.

Global vaccination rates have dropped for the first time in 28 years due to delivery disruptions caused by #COVID19.

@UNICEF & @WHO call for an urgent expansion & restoration of immunization services to tackle the alarming trend. https://t.co/LO002vNKe8 #VaccinesWork https://t.co/QbKNxss5nx

#COVID19 is dramatically affecting fragile & low-income countries, amplifying existing crises. 

$10.3 billion is needed to fight #coronavirus and provide life-saving aid to the most vulnerable.
